title: ldap settings refuse to save
body:
i have noticed this in owncloud 5.0 rc1 (installed on windows) and rc2 (installed on centos6).  

everything else works just fine, and other apps i enable can have their settings saved.  i have also tried this in chrome, internet explorer, and firefox.

i get these warning/errors repeatedly
debug	core	adding user backend instance of oca\user_ldap\user_proxy.	march 6, 2013 8:32
warning	user_ldap	either no password given for the user agent or a password is given, but no ldap agent; won`t connect.	march 6, 2013 8:32
debug	core	adding user backend instance of oc_user_database.	march 6, 2013 8:32
debug	core	include path for class "oc_group_custom" starts with "apps/"	march 6, 2013 8:32
debug	core	include path for class "oca_firstrunwizard\config" starts with "apps/"

i had owncloud 4.5.6 (i think, w/e the latest before 5.0 was) and ldap worked perfectly.  everything tests 100% fine, and i hit the save button, which lights up, but when the page gets reloaded everything just goes back to defaults.

i can also add multiple ldap(s) servers, and successfully test them, but when i hit the refresh button on the page same thing.

i have also just chmod'd my entire directory to 777 (this is a test environment at the moment, as i know this isnt the best or safest practice but i am just trying to troubleshoot...)
